title: Navigation Types Documentation
description: This document describes the type definitions for navigation items and their properties used in the application.
author: Documentation Team

blocks.content: This documentation provides an overview of the type definitions for navigation items used in the application. It includes details about the properties and structures that define how navigation is represented.
The `NavItem` type represents a single navigation item. It includes properties such as `title`, `path`, and optional fields for sub-items and display flags.
The `NavigationProps` interface defines the properties required for rendering a navigation component, including the locale and a collection of navigation items.
The `NavItemProps` interface represents the properties required for rendering an individual navigation item, including the current path and depth in the navigation hierarchy.

This documentation outlines the essential types and interfaces for navigation items in the application. Understanding these definitions is crucial for implementing and customizing navigation components effectively.
